result.execSummary:
The defendant Azaria Ayaleigh Flatoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $100 plus costs. 
  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Pay restitution of $205.24, joint and several with Ms. Osowski.
Work full time or school full time unless disability prevents her from doing so.

No contact with Patricia Vaughn with the exception she write a letter of apology within 30 days and forward to her agent for approval. 
No contact with Tracy Osowski.
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by her agent.

timeConds.notes:
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Azaria Ayaleigh Flatoff in court with attorney Karen jo Lueschow. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:06 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  Makes additional statements. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Atty Cousins makes statements to the Court.  

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count to is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Lueschow makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for 24 months:
Serve 30 days in jail.
Huber for employment and any counseling she may be involved in. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Pay restitution of $205.24, joint and several with Ms. Osowski. 
Pay $100 fine plus costs. 
No contact with Patricia Vaughn with the exception she write a letter of apology within 30 days and forward to her agent for approval.
No contact with Tracy Osowski. 
Work fulltime or school fulltime unless disability prevents her from doing so. 
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by her agent. 

Atty Lueschow indicates joint and several restitution is $205.24.
Plea hearing on March 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Lueschow

Court calls case at 3:17 pm.  Was to be heard in Br 2, but moved to Br 3.
Defendant Azaria Ayaleigh Flatoff in court with attorney Karen jo Lueschow.  ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Arraignment:

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Azaria Ayaleigh Flatoff in court. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant indicates she was under the impression she would be represented by Atty Lueschow.  Has not spoken to her yet. 
Court advises defendant to go to the Public Defender this afternoon. 
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with Patricia Vaughan and Tracy Osowski. 
Not possess/consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Within 24 hours she is to contact the Public Defender to see if she can be represented thru them.

Defendant Azaria Ayaleigh Flatoff appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Veronica Isherwood appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Isherwood states reason for appearance today.  
Court reviews the file.  Questions defendant.
Defendant indicates she was unaware of the Court date.  The warrant has her ex husbands address on it. She is currently on probation and reports for day report.  Karen Lueschows represented her on other matters. 
Atty Isherwood asks for an updated address for the defendant. 
Defendant indicates she is staying at the salvation army.  Working with probation to transfer to Waupaca.  She is not on a PO hold at this time.  She came in to day report and they arrested her on the warrant.  Tracy Kostuchowski is her agent. 
Atty Isherwood recommends a $2,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. Asks the defe  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
